page.title: 02St. Oswalds Park
page.content:
****************
St. Oswalds is one of the parks in Newton Aycliffe. It is named after one of the Bishop's of Durham. It is about the only park that is locked at certain times and has a park attendant there constantly. There is a roller skating rink there. It costs about 15p-30p to get into the rink. Sometimes it is used as a five-a-side pitch. One park, enclosed by fence, is for the under fives only. The rest is for anybody. During the week there is a playschool held in one of the buildings. There is also a nice bowling pitch there which is usually used in summer. There are also well kept flower beds and lawns.
